text: Inasmuch as many have undertaken to compile an account of the things accomplished among us,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as they were handed down to us by those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and servants of the word,
speaker: Narrator

text: it seemed fitting for me as well, having investigated everything carefully from the beginning, to write it out for you in consecutive order, most excellent Theophilus;
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may know the exact truth about the things you have been taught.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the days of Herod, king of Judea, there was a priest named Zacharias, of the division of Abijah; and he had a wife from the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were both righteous in the sight of God, walking blamelessly in all the commandments and requirements of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they were both advanced in years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it happened that while he was performing his priestly service before God in the appointed order of his division,
speaker: Narrator

text: according to the custom of the priestly office, he was chosen by lot to enter the temple of the Lord and burn incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole multitude of the people were in prayer outside at the hour of the incense offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing to the right of the altar of incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zacharias was troubled when he saw the angel, and fear gripped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the angel said to him, “Do not be afraid, Zacharias, for your petition has been heard, and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you will give him the name John.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he will be great in the sight of the Lord; and he will drink no wine or liquor, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit while yet in his mother’s womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will turn many of the sons of Israel back to the Lord their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is he who will go as a forerunner before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers back to the children, and the disobedient to the attitude of the righteous, so as to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Zacharias said to the angel, “How will I know this for certain? For I am an old man and my wife is advanced in years.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel answered and said to him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God, and I have been sent to speak to you and to bring you this good news.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, you shall be silent and unable to speak until the day when these things take place, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their proper time.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The people were waiting for Zacharias, and were wondering at his delay in the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he came out, he was unable to speak to them; and they realized that he had seen a vision in the temple; and he kept making signs to them, and remained mute.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the days of his priestly service were ended, he went back home.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these days Elizabeth his wife became pregnant, and she kept herself in seclusion for five months, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is the way the Lord has dealt with me in the days when He looked with favor upon me, to take away my disgrace among men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city in Galilee called Nazareth,
speaker: Narrator

text: to a virgin engaged to a man whose name was Joseph, of the descendants of David; and the virgin’s name was Mary.
speaker: Narrator

text: And coming in, he said to her, “Greetings, favored one! The Lord is with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But she was very perplexed at this statement, and kept pondering what kind of salutation this was.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary; for you have found favor with God.
speaker: Jesus

text: And behold, you will conceive in your womb and bear a son, and you shall name Him Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High; and the Lord God will give Him the throne of His father David;
speaker: Jesus

text: and He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and His kingdom will have no end.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary said to the angel, “How can this be, since I am a virgin?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel answered and said to her, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you; and for that reason the holy Child shall be called the Son of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: And behold, even your relative Elizabeth has also conceived a son in her old age; and she who was called barren is now in her sixth month.
speaker: Narrator

text: For nothing will be impossible with God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mary said, “Behold, the bondslave of the Lord; may it be done to me according to your word.” And the angel departed from her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at this time Mary arose and went in a hurry to the hill country, to a city of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and entered the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb; and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she cried out with a loud voice and said, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!
speaker: Narrator

text: And how has it happened to me, that the mother of my Lord would come to me?
speaker: Narrator

text: For behold, when the sound of your greeting reached my ears, the baby leaped in my womb for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And blessed is she who believed that there would be a fulfillment of what had been spoken to her by the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And Mary said:
“My soul exalts the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: And my spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For He has had regard for the humble state of His bondslave;
For behold, from this time on all generations will count me blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For the Mighty One has done great things for me;
And holy is His name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“And His mercy is upon generation after generation
Toward those who fear Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He has done mighty deeds with His arm;
He has scattered those who were proud in the thoughts of their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He has brought down rulers from their thrones,
And has exalted those who were humble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He has filled the hungry with good things;
And sent away the rich empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He has given help to Israel His servant,
In remembrance of His mercy,
speaker: Narrator

text:
As He spoke to our fathers,
To Abraham and his descendants forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mary stayed with her about three months, and then returned to her home.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the time had come for Elizabeth to give birth, and she gave birth to a son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her neighbors and her relatives heard that the Lord had displayed His great mercy toward her; and they were rejoicing with her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they were going to call him Zacharias, after his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his mother answered and said, “No indeed; but he shall be called John.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who is called by that name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made signs to his father, as to what he wanted him called.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he asked for a tablet and wrote as follows, “His name is John.” And they were all astonished.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at once his mouth was opened and his tongue loosed, and he began to speak in praise of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear came on all those living around them; and all these matters were being talked about in all the hill country of Judea.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who heard them kept them in mind, saying, “What then will this child turn out to be?” For the hand of the Lord was certainly with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,
For He has visited us and accomplished redemption for His people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And has raised up a horn of salvation for us
In the house of David His servant—
speaker: Narrator

text: As He spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets from of old—
speaker: Narrator

text:
Salvation from our enemies,
And from the hand of all who hate us;
speaker: Narrator

text:
To show mercy toward our fathers,
And to remember His holy covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: The oath which He swore to Abraham our father,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To grant us that we, being rescued from the hand of our enemies,
Might serve Him without fear,
speaker: Narrator

text: In holiness and righteousness before Him all our days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Most High;
For you will go on before the Lord to prepare His ways;
speaker: Narrator

text:
To give to His people the knowledge of salvation
By the forgiveness of their sins,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of the tender mercy of our God,
With which the Sunrise from on high will visit us,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To shine upon those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death,
To guide our feet into the way of peace.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the child continued to grow and to become strong in spirit, and he lived in the deserts until the day of his public appearance to Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus, that a census be taken of all the inhabited earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the first census taken while Quirinius was governor of Syria.
speaker: Narrator

text: And everyone was on his way to register for the census, each to his own city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph also went up from Galilee, from the city of Nazareth, to Judea, to the city of David which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family of David,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order to register along with Mary, who was engaged to him, and was with child.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were there, the days were completed for her to give birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she gave birth to her firstborn son; and she wrapped Him in cloths, and laid Him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same region there were some shepherds staying out in the fields and keeping watch over their flock by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And an angel of the Lord suddenly stood before them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them; and they were terribly frightened.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid; for behold, I bring you good news of great joy which will be for all the people;
speaker: Narrator

text: for today in the city of David there has been born for you a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: This will be a sign for you: you will find a baby wrapped in cloths and lying in a manger.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And suddenly there appeared with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God and saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Glory to God in the highest,
And on earth peace among men with whom He is pleased.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the angels had gone away from them into heaven, the shepherds began saying to one another, “Let us go straight to Bethlehem then, and see this thing that has happened which the Lord has made known to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they came in a hurry and found their way to Mary and Joseph, and the baby as He lay in the manger.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had seen this, they made known the statement which had been told them about this Child.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all who heard it wondered at the things which were told them by the shepherds.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Mary treasured all these things, pondering them in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The shepherds went back, glorifying and praising God for all that they had heard and seen, just as had been told them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when eight days had passed, before His circumcision, His name was then called Jesus, the name given by the angel before He was conceived in the womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the days for their purification according to the law of Moses were completed, they brought Him up to Jerusalem to present Him to the Lord
speaker: Narrator

text: (as it is written in the Law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male that opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord”),
speaker: Narrator

text: and to offer a sacrifice according to what was said in the Law of the Lord, “A pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon; and this man was righteous and devout, looking for the consolation of Israel; and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came in the Spirit into the temple; and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to carry out for Him the custom of the Law,
speaker: Narrator

text: then he took Him into his arms, and blessed God, and said,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Now Lord, You are releasing Your bond-servant to depart in peace,
According to Your word;
speaker: Narrator

text: For my eyes have seen Your salvation,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which You have prepared in the presence of all peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text:
A Light of revelation to the Gentiles,
And the glory of Your people Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And His father and mother were amazed at the things which were being said about Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Simeon blessed them and said to Mary His mother, “Behold, this Child is appointed for the fall and rise of many in Israel, and for a sign to be opposed—
speaker: Narrator

text: and a sword will pierce even your own soul—to the end that thoughts from many hearts may be revealed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a prophetess, Anna the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was advanced in years and had lived with her husband seven years after her marriage,
speaker: Narrator

text: and then as a widow to the age of eighty-four. She never left the temple, serving night and day with fastings and prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that very moment she came up and began giving thanks to God, and continued to speak of Him to all those who were looking for the redemption of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had performed everything according to the Law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own city of Nazareth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Child continued to grow and become strong, increasing in wisdom; and the grace of God was upon Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now His parents went to Jerusalem every year at the Feast of the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He became twelve, they went up there according to the custom of the Feast;
speaker: Narrator

text: and as they were returning, after spending the full number of days, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. But His parents were unaware of it,
speaker: Narrator

text: but supposed Him to be in the caravan, and went a day’s journey; and they began looking for Him among their relatives and acquaintances.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they did not find Him, they returned to Jerusalem looking for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then, after three days they found Him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, both listening to them and asking them questions.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all who heard Him were amazed at His understanding and His answers.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw Him, they were astonished; and His mother said to Him, “Son, why have You treated us this way? Behold, Your father and I have been anxiously looking for You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Why is it that you were looking for Me? Did you not know that I had to be in My Father’s house?”
speaker: Jesus

text: But they did not understand the statement which He had made to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He went down with them and came to Nazareth, and He continued in subjection to them; and His mother treasured all these things in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus kept increasing in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, and Herod was tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip was tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias was tetrarch of Abilene,
speaker: Narrator

text: in the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John, the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came into all the district around the Jordan, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins;
speaker: Narrator

text:
as it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet,
“The voice of one crying in the wilderness,
‘Make ready the way of the Lord,
Make His paths straight.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: And all flesh will see the salvation of God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he began saying to the crowds who were going out to be baptized by him, “You brood of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore bear fruits in keeping with repentance, and do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham for our father,’ for I say to you that from these stones God is able to raise up children to Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed the axe is already laid at the root of the trees; so every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the crowds were questioning him, saying, “Then what shall we do?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he would answer and say to them, “The man who has two tunics is to share with him who has none; and he who has food is to do likewise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And some tax collectors also came to be baptized, and they said to him, “Teacher, what shall we do?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Collect no more than what you have been ordered to.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Some soldiers were questioning him, saying, “And what about us, what shall we do?” And he said to them, “Do not take money from anyone by force, or accuse anyone falsely, and be content with your wages.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now while the people were in a state of expectation and all were wondering in their hearts about John, as to whether he was the Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered and said to them all, “As for me, I baptize you with water; but One is coming who is mightier than I, and I am not fit to untie the thong of His sandals; He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: His winnowing fork is in His hand to thoroughly clear His threshing floor, and to gather the wheat into His barn; but He will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So with many other exhortations he preached the gospel to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Herod the tetrarch was reprimanded by him because of Herodias, his brother’s wife, and because of all the wicked things which Herod had done,
speaker: Narrator

text: Herod also added this to them all: he locked John up in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when all the people were baptized, Jesus was also baptized, and while He was praying, heaven was opened,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Holy Spirit descended upon Him in bodily form like a dove, and a voice came out of heaven, “You are My beloved Son, in You I am well-pleased.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When He began His ministry, Jesus Himself was about thirty years of age, being, as was supposed, the son of Joseph, the son of Eli,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Hesli, the son of Naggai,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Amminadab, the son of Admin, the son of Ram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Heber, the son of Shelah,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan,
speaker: Narrator

text: the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led around by the Spirit in the wilderness
speaker: Narrator

text: for forty days, being tempted by the devil. And He ate nothing during those days, and when they had ended, He became hungry.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the devil said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live on bread alone.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he led Him up and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the devil said to Him, “I will give You all this domain and its glory; for it has been handed over to me, and I give it to whomever I wish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore if You worship before me, it shall all be Yours.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God and serve Him only.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he led Him to Jerusalem and had Him stand on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here;
speaker: Narrator

text:
for it is written,
‘He will command His angels concerning You to guard You,’
speaker: Narrator

text:
and,
‘On their hands they will bear You up,
So that You will not strike Your foot against a stone.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered and said to him, “It is said, ‘You shall not put the Lord your God to the test.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: When the devil had finished every temptation, he left Him until an opportune time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Spirit, and news about Him spread through all the surrounding district.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He began teaching in their synagogues and was praised by all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came to Nazareth, where He had been brought up; and as was His custom, He entered the synagogue on the Sabbath, and stood up to read.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the book of the prophet Isaiah was handed to Him. And He opened the book and found the place where it was written,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The Spirit of the Lord is upon Me,
Because He anointed Me to preach the gospel to the poor.
He has sent Me to proclaim release to the captives,
And recovery of sight to the blind,
To set free those who are oppressed,
speaker: Jesus

text: To proclaim the favorable year of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He closed the book, gave it back to the attendant and sat down; and the eyes of all in the synagogue were fixed on Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He began to say to them, “Today this Scripture has been fulfilled in your hearing.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And all were speaking well of Him, and wondering at the gracious words which were falling from His lips; and they were saying, “Is this not Joseph’s son?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “No doubt you will quote this proverb to Me, ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we heard was done at Capernaum, do here in your hometown as well.’”
speaker: Jesus

text: And He said, “Truly I say to you, no prophet is welcome in his hometown.
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you in truth, there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the sky was shut up for three years and six months, when a great famine came over all the land;
speaker: Jesus

text: and yet Elijah was sent to none of them, but only to Zarephath, in the land of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.
speaker: Jesus

text: And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet; and none of them was cleansed, but only Naaman the Syrian.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And all the people in the synagogue were filled with rage as they heard these things;
speaker: Jesus

text: and they got up and drove Him out of the city, and led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city had been built, in order to throw Him down the cliff.
speaker: Narrator

text: But passing through their midst, He went His way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and He was teaching them on the Sabbath;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they were amazed at His teaching, for His message was with authority.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the synagogue there was a man possessed by the spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Let us alone! What business do we have with each other, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know who You are—the Holy One of God!”
speaker: Jesus

text: But Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet and come out of him!” And when the demon had thrown him down in the midst of the people, he came out of him without doing him any harm.
speaker: Jesus

text: And amazement came upon them all, and they began talking with one another saying, “What is this message? For with authority and power He commands the unclean spirits and they come out.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the report about Him was spreading into every locality in the surrounding district.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He got up and left the synagogue, and entered Simon’s home. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked Him to help her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And standing over her, He rebuked the fever, and it left her; and she immediately got up and waited on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: While the sun was setting, all those who had any who were sick with various diseases brought them to Him; and laying His hands on each one of them, He was healing them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Demons also were coming out of many, shouting, “You are the Son of God!” But rebuking them, He would not allow them to speak, because they knew Him to be the Christ.
speaker: Jesus

text: When day came, Jesus left and went to a secluded place; and the crowds were searching for Him, and came to Him and tried to keep Him from going away from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to them, “I must preach the kingdom of God to the other cities also, for I was sent for this purpose.”
speaker: Jesus

text: So He kept on preaching in the synagogues of Judea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it happened that while the crowd was pressing around Him and listening to the word of God, He was standing by the lake of Gennesaret;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He saw two boats lying at the edge of the lake; but the fishermen had gotten out of them and were washing their nets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He got into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little way from the land. And He sat down and began teaching the people from the boat.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He had finished speaking, He said to Simon, “Put out into the deep water and let down your nets for a catch.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon answered and said, “Master, we worked hard all night and caught nothing, but I will do as You say and let down the nets.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had done this, they enclosed a great quantity of fish, and their nets began to break;
speaker: Narrator

text: so they signaled to their partners in the other boat for them to come and help them. And they came and filled both of the boats, so that they began to sink.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Simon Peter saw that, he fell down at Jesus’ feet, saying, “Go away from me Lord, for I am a sinful man!”
speaker: Narrator

text: For amazement had seized him and all his companions because of the catch of fish which they had taken;
speaker: Narrator

text: and so also were James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. And Jesus said to Simon, “Do not fear, from now on you will be catching men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had brought their boats to land, they left everything and followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: While He was in one of the cities, behold, there was a man covered with leprosy; and when he saw Jesus, he fell on his face and implored Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He stretched out His hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing; be cleansed.” And immediately the leprosy left him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He ordered him to tell no one, “But go and show yourself to the priest and make an offering for your cleansing, just as Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the news about Him was spreading even farther, and large crowds were gathering to hear Him and to be healed of their sicknesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus Himself would often slip away to the wilderness and pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: One day He was teaching; and there were some Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting there, who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem; and the power of the Lord was present for Him to perform healing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some men were carrying on a bed a man who was paralyzed; and they were trying to bring him in and to set him down in front of Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But not finding any way to bring him in because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down through the tiles with his stretcher, into the middle of the crowd, in front of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing their faith, He said, “Friend, your sins are forgiven you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this man who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, aware of their reasonings, answered and said to them, “Why are you reasoning in your hearts?
speaker: Narrator

text: Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins have been forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
speaker: Narrator

text: But, so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,”—He said to the paralytic—“I say to you, get up, and pick up your stretcher and go home.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately he got up before them, and picked up what he had been lying on, and went home glorifying God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were all struck with astonishment and began glorifying God; and they were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen remarkable things today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After that He went out and noticed a tax collector named Levi sitting in the tax booth, and He said to him, “Follow Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he left everything behind, and got up and began to follow Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Levi gave a big reception for Him in his house; and there was a great crowd of tax collectors and other people who were reclining at the table with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees and their scribes began grumbling at His disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with the tax collectors and sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “It is not those who are well who need a physician, but those who are sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to Him, “The disciples of John often fast and offer prayers, the disciples of the Pharisees also do the same, but Yours eat and drink.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “You cannot make the attendants of the bridegroom fast while the bridegroom is with them, can you?
speaker: Narrator

text: But the days will come; and when the bridegroom is taken away from them, then they will fast in those days.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was also telling them a parable: “No one tears a piece of cloth from a new garment and puts it on an old garment; otherwise he will both tear the new, and the piece from the new will not match the old.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins; otherwise the new wine will burst the skins and it will be spilled out, and the skins will be ruined.
speaker: Narrator

text: But new wine must be put into fresh wineskins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no one, after drinking old wine wishes for new; for he says, ‘The old is good enough.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it happened that He was passing through some grainfields on a Sabbath; and His disciples were picking the heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands, and eating the grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some of the Pharisees said, “Why do you do what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answering them said, “Have you not even read what David did when he was hungry, he and those who were with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: how he entered the house of God, and took and ate the consecrated bread which is not lawful for any to eat except the priests alone, and gave it to his companions?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying to them, “The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: On another Sabbath He entered the synagogue and was teaching; and there was a man there whose right hand was withered.
speaker: Narrator

text: The scribes and the Pharisees were watching Him closely to see if He healed on the Sabbath, so that they might find reason to accuse Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He knew what they were thinking, and He said to the man with the withered hand, “Get up and come forward!” And he got up and came forward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “I ask you, is it lawful to do good or to do harm on the Sabbath, to save a life or to destroy it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: After looking around at them all, He said to him, “Stretch out your hand!” And he did so; and his hand was restored.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they themselves were filled with rage, and discussed together what they might do to Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was at this time that He went off to the mountain to pray, and He spent the whole night in prayer to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when day came, He called His disciples to Him and chose twelve of them, whom He also named as apostles:
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon, whom He also named Peter, and Andrew his brother; and James and John; and Philip and Bartholomew;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Matthew and Thomas; James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon who was called the Zealot;
speaker: Narrator

text: Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus came down with them and stood on a level place; and there was a large crowd of His disciples, and a great throng of people from all Judea and Jerusalem and the coastal region of Tyre and Sidon,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had come to hear Him and to be healed of their diseases; and those who were troubled with unclean spirits were being cured.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people were trying to touch Him, for power was coming from Him and healing them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And turning His gaze toward His disciples, He began to say, “Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are you who hunger now, for you shall be satisfied. Blessed are you who weep now, for you shall laugh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are you when men hate you, and ostracize you, and insult you, and scorn your name as evil, for the sake of the Son of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be glad in that day and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in heaven. For in the same way their fathers used to treat the prophets.
speaker: Narrator

text: But woe to you who are rich, for you are receiving your comfort in full.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to you who are well-fed now, for you shall be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you shall mourn and weep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to you when all men speak well of you, for their fathers used to treat the false prophets in the same way.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But I say to you who hear, love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,
speaker: Narrator

text: bless those who curse you, pray for those who mistreat you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever hits you on the cheek, offer him the other also; and whoever takes away your coat, do not withhold your shirt from him either.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to everyone who asks of you, and whoever takes away what is yours, do not demand it back.
speaker: Narrator

text: Treat others the same way you want them to treat you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you lend to those from whom you expect to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners in order to receive back the same amount.
speaker: Narrator

text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return; and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High; for He Himself is kind to ungrateful and evil men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Do not judge, and you will not be judged; and do not condemn, and you will not be condemned; pardon, and you will be pardoned.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give, and it will be given to you. They will pour into your lap a good measure—pressed down, shaken together, and running over. For by your standard of measure it will be measured to you in return.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He also spoke a parable to them: “A blind man cannot guide a blind man, can he? Will they not both fall into a pit?
speaker: Narrator

text: A pupil is not above his teacher; but everyone, after he has been fully trained, will be like his teacher.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do you look at the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not notice the log that is in your own eye?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me take out the speck that is in your eye,’ when you yourself do not see the log that is in your own eye? You hypocrite, first take the log out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take out the speck that is in your brother’s eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is no good tree which produces bad fruit, nor, on the other hand, a bad tree which produces good fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For each tree is known by its own fruit. For men do not gather figs from thorns, nor do they pick grapes from a briar bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: The good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth what is good; and the evil man out of the evil treasure brings forth what is evil; for his mouth speaks from that which fills his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why do you call Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and do not do what I say?
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who comes to Me and hears My words and acts on them, I will show you whom he is like:
speaker: Narrator

text: he is like a man building a house, who dug deep and laid a foundation on the rock; and when a flood occurred, the torrent burst against that house and could not shake it, because it had been well built.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the one who has heard and has not acted accordingly, is like a man who built a house on the ground without any foundation; and the torrent burst against it and immediately it collapsed, and the ruin of that house was great.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When He had completed all His discourse in the hearing of the people, He went to Capernaum.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a centurion’s slave, who was highly regarded by him, was sick and about to die.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he heard about Jesus, he sent some Jewish elders asking Him to come and save the life of his slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to Jesus, they earnestly implored Him, saying, “He is worthy for You to grant this to him;
speaker: Narrator

text: for he loves our nation and it was he who built us our synagogue.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jesus started on His way with them; and when He was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends, saying to Him, “Lord, do not trouble Yourself further, for I am not worthy for You to come under my roof;
speaker: Narrator

text: for this reason I did not even consider myself worthy to come to You, but just say the word, and my servant will be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I also am a man placed under authority, with soldiers under me; and I say to this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes, and to my slave, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus heard this, He marveled at him, and turned and said to the crowd that was following Him, “I say to you, not even in Israel have I found such great faith.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When those who had been sent returned to the house, they found the slave in good health.
speaker: Narrator

text: Soon afterwards He went to a city called Nain; and His disciples were going along with Him, accompanied by a large crowd.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as He approached the gate of the city, a dead man was being carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow; and a sizeable crowd from the city was with her.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord saw her, He felt compassion for her, and said to her, “Do not weep.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came up and touched the coffin; and the bearers came to a halt. And He said, “Young man, I say to you, arise!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The dead man sat up and began to speak. And Jesus gave him back to his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear gripped them all, and they began glorifying God, saying, “A great prophet has arisen among us!” and, “God has visited His people!”
speaker: Narrator

text: This report concerning Him went out all over Judea and in all the surrounding district.
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples of John reported to him about all these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Summoning two of his disciples, John sent them to the Lord, saying, “Are You the Expected One, or do we look for someone else?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the men came to Him, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to You, to ask, ‘Are You the Expected One, or do we look for someone else?’”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that very time He cured many people of diseases and afflictions and evil spirits; and He gave sight to many who were blind.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He answered and said to them, “Go and report to John what you have seen and heard: the blind receive sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, the poor have the gospel preached to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is he who does not take offense at Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the messengers of John had left, He began to speak to the crowds about John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
speaker: Narrator

text: But what did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Those who are splendidly clothed and live in luxury are found in royal palaces!
speaker: Narrator

text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say to you, and one who is more than a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the one about whom it is written,
‘Behold, I send My messenger ahead of You,
Who will prepare Your way before You.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I say to you, among those born of women there is no one greater than John; yet he who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the people and the tax collectors heard this, they acknowledged God’s justice, having been baptized with the baptism of John.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected God’s purpose for themselves, not having been baptized by John.
speaker: Narrator

text: “To what then shall I compare the men of this generation, and what are they like?
speaker: Narrator

text: They are like children who sit in the market place and call to one another, and they say, ‘We played the flute for you, and you did not dance; we sang a dirge, and you did not weep.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For John the Baptist has come eating no bread and drinking no wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon!’
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet wisdom is vindicated by all her children.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now one of the Pharisees was requesting Him to dine with him, and He entered the Pharisee’s house and reclined at the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a woman in the city who was a sinner; and when she learned that He was reclining at the table in the Pharisee’s house, she brought an alabaster vial of perfume,
speaker: Narrator

text: and standing behind Him at His feet, weeping, she began to wet His feet with her tears, and kept wiping them with the hair of her head, and kissing His feet and anointing them with the perfume.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the Pharisee who had invited Him saw this, he said to himself, “If this man were a prophet He would know who and what sort of person this woman is who is touching Him, that she is a sinner.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to say to you.” And he replied, “Say it, Teacher.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “A moneylender had two debtors: one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they were unable to repay, he graciously forgave them both. So which of them will love him more?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon answered and said, “I suppose the one whom he forgave more.” And He said to him, “You have judged correctly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Turning toward the woman, He said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered your house; you gave Me no water for My feet, but she has wet My feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: You gave Me no kiss; but she, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss My feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: You did not anoint My head with oil, but she anointed My feet with perfume.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason I say to you, her sins, which are many, have been forgiven, for she loved much; but he who is forgiven little, loves little.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to her, “Your sins have been forgiven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were reclining at the table with Him began to say to themselves, “Who is this man who even forgives sins?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Soon afterwards, He began going around from one city and village to another, proclaiming and preaching the kingdom of God. The twelve were with Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and also some women who had been healed of evil spirits and sicknesses: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joanna the wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others who were contributing to their support out of their private means.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a large crowd was coming together, and those from the various cities were journeying to Him, He spoke by way of a parable:
speaker: Narrator

text: “The sower went out to sow his seed; and as he sowed, some fell beside the road, and it was trampled under foot and the birds of the air ate it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell on rocky soil, and as soon as it grew up, it withered away, because it had no moisture.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell among the thorns; and the thorns grew up with it and choked it out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell into the good soil, and grew up, and produced a crop a hundred times as great.” As He said these things, He would call out, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples began questioning Him as to what this parable meant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “To you it has been granted to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God, but to the rest it is in parables, so that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now the parable is this: the seed is the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those beside the road are those who have heard; then the devil comes and takes away the word from their heart, so that they will not believe and be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those on the rocky soil are those who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no firm root; they believe for a while, and in time of temptation fall away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed which fell among the thorns, these are the ones who have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with worries and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to maturity.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the seed in the good soil, these are the ones who have heard the word in an honest and good heart, and hold it fast, and bear fruit with perseverance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now no one after lighting a lamp covers it over with a container, or puts it under a bed; but he puts it on a lampstand, so that those who come in may see the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: For nothing is hidden that will not become evident, nor anything secret that will not be known and come to light.
speaker: Narrator

text: So take care how you listen; for whoever has, to him more shall be given; and whoever does not have, even what he thinks he has shall be taken away from him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And His mother and brothers came to Him, and they were unable to get to Him because of the crowd.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was reported to Him, “Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, wishing to see You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He answered and said to them, “My mother and My brothers are these who hear the word of God and do it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on one of those days Jesus and His disciples got into a boat, and He said to them, “Let us go over to the other side of the lake.” So they launched out.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as they were sailing along He fell asleep; and a fierce gale of wind descended on the lake, and they began to be swamped and to be in danger.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to Jesus and woke Him up, saying, “Master, Master, we are perishing!” And He got up and rebuked the wind and the surging waves, and they stopped, and it became calm.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Where is your faith?” They were fearful and amazed, saying to one another, “Who then is this, that He commands even the winds and the water, and they obey Him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they sailed to the country of the Gerasenes, which is opposite Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He came out onto the land, He was met by a man from the city who was possessed with demons; and who had not put on any clothing for a long time, and was not living in a house, but in the tombs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing Jesus, he cried out and fell before Him, and said in a loud voice, “What business do we have with each other, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg You, do not torment me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For He had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For it had seized him many times; and he was bound with chains and shackles and kept under guard, and yet he would break his bonds and be driven by the demon into the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” And he said, “Legion”; for many demons had entered him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were imploring Him not to command them to go away into the abyss.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a herd of many swine feeding there on the mountain; and the demons implored Him to permit them to enter the swine. And He gave them permission.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the demons came out of the man and entered the swine; and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and was drowned.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the herdsmen saw what had happened, they ran away and reported it in the city and out in the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people went out to see what had happened; and they came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting down at the feet of Jesus, clothed and in his right mind; and they became frightened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who had seen it reported to them how the man who was demon-possessed had been made well.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people of the country of the Gerasenes and the surrounding district asked Him to leave them, for they were gripped with great fear; and He got into a boat and returned.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the man from whom the demons had gone out was begging Him that he might accompany Him; but He sent him away, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Return to your house and describe what great things God has done for you.” So he went away, proclaiming throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as Jesus returned, the people welcomed Him, for they had all been waiting for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there came a man named Jairus, and he was an official of the synagogue; and he fell at Jesus’ feet, and began to implore Him to come to his house;
speaker: Narrator

text: for he had an only daughter, about twelve years old, and she was dying. But as He went, the crowds were pressing against Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a woman who had a hemorrhage for twelve years, and could not be healed by anyone,
speaker: Narrator

text: came up behind Him and touched the fringe of His cloak, and immediately her hemorrhage stopped.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said, “Who is the one who touched Me?” And while they were all denying it, Peter said, “Master, the people are crowding and pressing in on You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said, “Someone did touch Me, for I was aware that power had gone out of Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the woman saw that she had not escaped notice, she came trembling and fell down before Him, and declared in the presence of all the people the reason why she had touched Him, and how she had been immediately healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well; go in peace.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While He was still speaking, someone came from the house of the synagogue official, saying, “Your daughter has died; do not trouble the Teacher anymore.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jesus heard this, He answered him, “Do not be afraid any longer; only believe, and she will be made well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When He came to the house, He did not allow anyone to enter with Him, except Peter and John and James, and the girl’s father and mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they were all weeping and lamenting for her; but He said, “Stop weeping, for she has not died, but is asleep.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they began laughing at Him, knowing that she had died.
speaker: Narrator

text: He, however, took her by the hand and called, saying, “Child, arise!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And her spirit returned, and she got up immediately; and He gave orders for something to be given her to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her parents were amazed; but He instructed them to tell no one what had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He called the twelve together, and gave them power and authority over all the demons and to heal diseases.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to perform healing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Take nothing for your journey, neither a staff, nor a bag, nor bread, nor money; and do not even have two tunics apiece.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatever house you enter, stay there until you leave that city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for those who do not receive you, as you go out from that city, shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Departing, they began going throughout the villages, preaching the gospel and healing everywhere.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was happening; and he was greatly perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead,
speaker: Narrator

text: and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the prophets of old had risen again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Herod said, “I myself had John beheaded; but who is this man about whom I hear such things?” And he kept trying to see Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the apostles returned, they gave an account to Him of all that they had done. Taking them with Him, He withdrew by Himself to a city called Bethsaida.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the crowds were aware of this and followed Him; and welcoming them, He began speaking to them about the kingdom of God and curing those who had need of healing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the day was ending, and the twelve came and said to Him, “Send the crowd away, that they may go into the surrounding villages and countryside and find lodging and get something to eat; for here we are in a desolate place.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to them, “You give them something to eat!” And they said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless perhaps we go and buy food for all these people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (For there were about five thousand men.) And He said to His disciples, “Have them sit down to eat in groups of about fifty each.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They did so, and had them all sit down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed them, and broke them, and kept giving them to the disciples to set before the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they all ate and were satisfied; and the broken pieces which they had left over were picked up, twelve baskets full.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that while He was praying alone, the disciples were with Him, and He questioned them, saying, “Who do the people say that I am?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered and said, “John the Baptist, and others say Elijah; but others, that one of the prophets of old has risen again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” And Peter answered and said, “The Christ of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He warned them and instructed them not to tell this to anyone,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed and be raised up on the third day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying to them all, “If anyone wishes to come after Me, he must deny himself, and take up his cross daily and follow Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever wishes to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake, he is the one who will save it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what is a man profited if he gains the whole world, and loses or forfeits himself?
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever is ashamed of Me and My words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of him when He comes in His glory, and the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I say to you truthfully, there are some of those standing here who will not taste death until they see the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Some eight days after these sayings, He took along Peter and John and James, and went up on the mountain to pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: And while He was praying, the appearance of His face became different, and His clothing became white and gleaming.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, two men were talking with Him; and they were Moses and Elijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who, appearing in glory, were speaking of His departure which He was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Peter and his companions had been overcome with sleep; but when they were fully awake, they saw His glory and the two men standing with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as these were leaving Him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here; let us make three tabernacles: one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah”—not realizing what he was saying.
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was saying this, a cloud formed and began to overshadow them; and they were afraid as they entered the cloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My Son, My Chosen One; listen to Him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the voice had spoken, Jesus was found alone. And they kept silent, and reported to no one in those days any of the things which they had seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day, when they came down from the mountain, a large crowd met Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a man from the crowd shouted, saying, “Teacher, I beg You to look at my son, for he is my only boy,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a spirit seizes him, and he suddenly screams, and it throws him into a convulsion with foaming at the mouth; and only with difficulty does it leave him, mauling him as it leaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: I begged Your disciples to cast it out, and they could not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered and said, “You unbelieving and perverted generation, how long shall I be with you and put up with you? Bring your son here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still approaching, the demon slammed him to the ground and threw him into a convulsion. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the boy and gave him back to his father.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they were all amazed at the greatness of God.
But while everyone was marveling at all that He was doing, He said to His disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Let these words sink into your ears; for the Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they did not understand this statement, and it was concealed from them so that they would not perceive it; and they were afraid to ask Him about this statement.
speaker: Narrator

text: An argument started among them as to which of them might be the greatest.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, knowing what they were thinking in their heart, took a child and stood him by His side,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to them, “Whoever receives this child in My name receives Me, and whoever receives Me receives Him who sent Me; for the one who is least among all of you, this is the one who is great.”
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered and said, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in Your name; and we tried to prevent him because he does not follow along with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to him, “Do not hinder him; for he who is not against you is for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the days were approaching for His ascension, He was determined to go to Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He sent messengers on ahead of Him, and they went and entered a village of the Samaritans to make arrangements for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they did not receive Him, because He was traveling toward Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: When His disciples James and John saw this, they said, “Lord, do You want us to command fire to come down from heaven and consume them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He turned and rebuked them, [and said, “You do not know what kind of spirit you are of;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Son of Man did not come to destroy men’s lives, but to save them.”] And they went on to another village.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were going along the road, someone said to Him, “I will follow You wherever You go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes and the birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to another, “Follow Me.” But he said, “Lord, permit me first to go and bury my father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to him, “Allow the dead to bury their own dead; but as for you, go and proclaim everywhere the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Another also said, “I will follow You, Lord; but first permit me to say good-bye to those at home.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to him, “No one, after putting his hand to the plow and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after this the Lord appointed seventy others, and sent them in pairs ahead of Him to every city and place where He Himself was going to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying to them, “The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few; therefore beseech the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into His harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go; behold, I send you out as lambs in the midst of wolves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Carry no money belt, no bag, no shoes; and greet no one on the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace be to this house.’
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man of peace is there, your peace will rest on him; but if not, it will return to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stay in that house, eating and drinking what they give you; for the laborer is worthy of his wages. Do not keep moving from house to house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatever city you enter and they receive you, eat what is set before you;
speaker: Narrator

text: and heal those in it who are sick, and say to them, ‘The kingdom of God has come near to you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But whatever city you enter and they do not receive you, go out into its streets and say,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Even the dust of your city which clings to our feet we wipe off in protest against you; yet be sure of this, that the kingdom of God has come near.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I say to you, it will be more tolerable in that day for Sodom than for that city.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles had been performed in Tyre and Sidon which occurred in you, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you, Capernaum, will not be exalted to heaven, will you? You will be brought down to Hades!
speaker: Narrator

text: “The one who listens to you listens to Me, and the one who rejects you rejects Me; and he who rejects Me rejects the One who sent Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The seventy returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in Your name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “I was watching Satan fall from heaven like lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have given you authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing will injure you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice that your names are recorded in heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that very time He rejoiced greatly in the Holy Spirit, and said, “I praise You, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent and have revealed them to infants. Yes, Father, for this way was well-pleasing in Your sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things have been handed over to Me by My Father, and no one knows who the Son is except the Father, and who the Father is except the Son, and anyone to whom the Son wills to reveal Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Turning to the disciples, He said privately, “Blessed are the eyes which see the things you see,
speaker: Narrator

text: for I say to you, that many prophets and kings wished to see the things which you see, and did not see them, and to hear the things which you hear, and did not hear them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And a lawyer stood up and put Him to the test, saying, “Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to him, “What is written in the Law? How does it read to you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your strength, and with all your mind; and your neighbor as yourself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to him, “You have answered correctly; do this and you will live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But wishing to justify himself, he said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied and said, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among robbers, and they stripped him and beat him, and went away leaving him half dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And by chance a priest was going down on that road, and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise a Levite also, when he came to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: But a Samaritan, who was on a journey, came upon him; and when he saw him, he felt compassion,
speaker: Narrator

text: and came to him and bandaged up his wounds, pouring oil and wine on them; and he put him on his own beast, and brought him to an inn and took care of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day he took out two denarii and gave them to the innkeeper and said, ‘Take care of him; and whatever more you spend, when I return I will repay you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Which of these three do you think proved to be a neighbor to the man who fell into the robbers’ hands?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “The one who showed mercy toward him.” Then Jesus said to him, “Go and do the same.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as they were traveling along, He entered a village; and a woman named Martha welcomed Him into her home.
speaker: Narrator

text: She had a sister called Mary, who was seated at the Lord’s feet, listening to His word.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Martha was distracted with all her preparations; and she came up to Him and said, “Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me to do all the serving alone? Then tell her to help me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord answered and said to her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and bothered about so many things;
speaker: Narrator

text: but only one thing is necessary, for Mary has chosen the good part, which shall not be taken away from her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: It happened that while Jesus was praying in a certain place, after He had finished, one of His disciples said to Him, “Lord, teach us to pray just as John also taught his disciples.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He said to them, “When you pray, say:
‘Father, hallowed be Your name.
Your kingdom come.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Give us each day our daily bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘And forgive us our sins,
For we ourselves also forgive everyone who is indebted to us.
And lead us not into temptation.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to them, “Suppose one of you has a friend, and goes to him at midnight and says to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves;
speaker: Narrator

text: for a friend of mine has come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him’;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from inside he answers and says, ‘Do not bother me; the door has already been shut and my children and I are in bed; I cannot get up and give you anything.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, even though he will not get up and give him anything because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence he will get up and give him as much as he needs.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So I say to you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For everyone who asks, receives; and he who seeks, finds; and to him who knocks, it will be opened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now suppose one of you fathers is asked by his son for a fish; he will not give him a snake instead of a fish, will he?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if he is asked for an egg, he will not give him a scorpion, will he?
speaker: Narrator

text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask Him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was casting out a demon, and it was mute; when the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke; and the crowds were amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some of them said, “He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the ruler of the demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Others, to test Him, were demanding of Him a sign from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: But He knew their thoughts and said to them, “Any kingdom divided against itself is laid waste; and a house divided against itself falls.
speaker: Narrator

text: If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if I by Beelzebul cast out demons, by whom do your sons cast them out? So they will be your judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I cast out demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own house, his possessions are undisturbed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when someone stronger than he attacks him and overpowers him, he takes away from him all his armor on which he had relied and distributes his plunder.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who is not with Me is against Me; and he who does not gather with Me, scatters.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the unclean spirit goes out of a man, it passes through waterless places seeking rest, and not finding any, it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And when it comes, it finds it swept and put in order.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it goes and takes along seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and live there; and the last state of that man becomes worse than the first.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While Jesus was saying these things, one of the women in the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, “Blessed is the womb that bore You and the breasts at which You nursed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said, “On the contrary, blessed are those who hear the word of God and observe it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As the crowds were increasing, He began to say, “This generation is a wicked generation; it seeks for a sign, and yet no sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so will the Son of Man be to this generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Queen of the South will rise up with the men of this generation at the judgment and condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, something greater than Solomon is here.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men of Nineveh will stand up with this generation at the judgment and condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, something greater than Jonah is here.
speaker: Narrator

text: “No one, after lighting a lamp, puts it away in a cellar nor under a basket, but on the lampstand, so that those who enter may see the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eye is the lamp of your body; when your eye is clear, your whole body also is full of light; but when it is bad, your body also is full of darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then watch out that the light in you is not darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: If therefore your whole body is full of light, with no dark part in it, it will be wholly illumined, as when the lamp illumines you with its rays.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when He had spoken, a Pharisee asked Him to have lunch with him; and He went in, and reclined at the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Pharisee saw it, he was surprised that He had not first ceremonially washed before the meal.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and of the platter; but inside of you, you are full of robbery and wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: You foolish ones, did not He who made the outside make the inside also?
speaker: Narrator

text: But give that which is within as charity, and then all things are clean for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But woe to you Pharisees! For you pay tithe of mint and rue and every kind of garden herb, and yet disregard justice and the love of God; but these are the things you should have done without neglecting the others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the chief seats in the synagogues and the respectful greetings in the market places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to you! For you are like concealed tombs, and the people who walk over them are unaware of it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the lawyers said to Him in reply, “Teacher, when You say this, You insult us too.”
speaker: Narrator
