text: But He said, “Woe to you lawyers as well! For you weigh men down with burdens hard to bear, while you yourselves will not even touch the burdens with one of your fingers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and it was your fathers who killed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you are witnesses and approve the deeds of your fathers; because it was they who killed them, and you build their tombs.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send to them prophets and apostles, and some of them they will kill and some they will persecute,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the blood of all the prophets, shed since the foundation of the world, may be charged against this generation,
speaker: Narrator

text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the house of God; yes, I tell you, it shall be charged against this generation.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to you lawyers! For you have taken away the key of knowledge; you yourselves did not enter, and you hindered those who were entering.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When He left there, the scribes and the Pharisees began to be very hostile and to question Him closely on many subjects,
speaker: Narrator

text: plotting against Him to catch Him in something He might say.
speaker: Narrator

text: Under these circumstances, after so many thousands of people had gathered together that they were stepping on one another, He began saying to His disciples first of all, “Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there is nothing covered up that will not be revealed, and hidden that will not be known.
speaker: Narrator

text: Accordingly, whatever you have said in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have whispered in the inner rooms will be proclaimed upon the housetops.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I say to you, My friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body and after that have no more that they can do.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will warn you whom to fear: fear the One who, after He has killed, has authority to cast into hell; yes, I tell you, fear Him!
speaker: Narrator

text: Are not five sparrows sold for two cents? Yet not one of them is forgotten before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Do not fear; you are more valuable than many sparrows.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And I say to you, everyone who confesses Me before men, the Son of Man will confess him also before the angels of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: but he who denies Me before men will be denied before the angels of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but he who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they bring you before the synagogues and the rulers and the authorities, do not worry about how or what you are to speak in your defense, or what you are to say;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that very hour what you ought to say.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Someone in the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the family inheritance with me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to him, “Man, who appointed Me a judge or arbitrator over you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to them, “Beware, and be on your guard against every form of greed; for not even when one has an abundance does his life consist of his possessions.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He told them a parable, saying, “The land of a rich man was very productive.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he began reasoning to himself, saying, ‘What shall I do, since I have no place to store my crops?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, ‘This is what I will do: I will tear down my barns and build larger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will say to my soul, “Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years to come; take your ease, eat, drink and be merry.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: But God said to him, ‘You fool! This very night your soul is required of you; and now who will own what you have prepared?’
speaker: Narrator

text: So is the man who stores up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to His disciples, “For this reason I say to you, do not worry about your life, as to what you will eat; nor for your body, as to what you will put on.
speaker: Narrator

text: For life is more than food, and the body more than clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider the ravens, for they neither sow nor reap; they have no storeroom nor barn, and yet God feeds them; how much more valuable you are than the birds!
speaker: Narrator

text: And which of you by worrying can add a single hour to his life’s span?
speaker: Narrator

text: If then you cannot do even a very little thing, why do you worry about other matters?
speaker: Narrator

text: Consider the lilies, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin; but I tell you, not even Solomon in all his glory clothed himself like one of these.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if God so clothes the grass in the field, which is alive today and tomorrow is thrown into the furnace, how much more will He clothe you? You men of little faith!
speaker: Narrator

text: And do not seek what you will eat and what you will drink, and do not keep worrying.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all these things the nations of the world eagerly seek; but your Father knows that you need these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But seek His kingdom, and these things will be added to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father has chosen gladly to give you the kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Sell your possessions and give to charity; make yourselves money belts which do not wear out, an unfailing treasure in heaven, where no thief comes near nor moth destroys.
speaker: Narrator

text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Be dressed in readiness, and keep your lamps lit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be like men who are waiting for their master when he returns from the wedding feast, so that they may immediately open the door to him when he comes and knocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed are those slaves whom the master will find on the alert when he comes; truly I say to you, that he will gird himself to serve, and have them recline at the table, and will come up and wait on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whether he comes in the second watch, or even in the third, and finds them so, blessed are those slaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But be sure of this, that if the head of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have allowed his house to be broken into.
speaker: Narrator

text: You too, be ready; for the Son of Man is coming at an hour that you do not expect.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said, “Lord, are You addressing this parable to us, or to everyone else as well?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, “Who then is the faithful and sensible steward, whom his master will put in charge of his servants, to give them their rations at the proper time?
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is that slave whom his master finds so doing when he comes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I say to you that he will put him in charge of all his possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if that slave says in his heart, ‘My master will be a long time in coming,’ and begins to beat the slaves, both men and women, and to eat and drink and get drunk;
speaker: Narrator

text: the master of that slave will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he does not know, and will cut him in pieces, and assign him a place with the unbelievers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that slave who knew his master’s will and did not get ready or act in accord with his will, will receive many lashes,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the one who did not know it, and committed deeds worthy of a flogging, will receive but few. From everyone who has been given much, much will be required; and to whom they entrusted much, of him they will ask all the more.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have come to cast fire upon the earth; and how I wish it were already kindled!
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have a baptism to undergo, and how distressed I am until it is accomplished!
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you suppose that I came to grant peace on earth? I tell you, no, but rather division;
speaker: Narrator

text: for from now on five members in one household will be divided, three against two and two against three.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was also saying to the crowds, “When you see a cloud rising in the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower is coming,’ and so it turns out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you see a south wind blowing, you say, ‘It will be a hot day,’ and it turns out that way.
speaker: Narrator

text: You hypocrites! You know how to analyze the appearance of the earth and the sky, but why do you not analyze this present time?
speaker: Narrator

text: “And why do you not even on your own initiative judge what is right?
speaker: Narrator

text: For while you are going with your opponent to appear before the magistrate, on your way there make an effort to settle with him, so that he may not drag you before the judge, and the judge turn you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say to you, you will not get out of there until you have paid the very last cent.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the same occasion there were some present who reported to Him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “Do you suppose that these Galileans were greater sinners than all other Galileans because they suffered this fate?
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, no, but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or do you suppose that those eighteen on whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them were worse culprits than all the men who live in Jerusalem?
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, no, but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He began telling this parable: “A man had a fig tree which had been planted in his vineyard; and he came looking for fruit on it and did not find any.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to the vineyard-keeper, ‘Behold, for three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree without finding any. Cut it down! Why does it even use up the ground?’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered and said to him, ‘Let it alone, sir, for this year too, until I dig around it and put in fertilizer;
speaker: Narrator

text: and if it bears fruit next year, fine; but if not, cut it down.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a woman who for eighteen years had had a sickness caused by a spirit; and she was bent double, and could not straighten up at all.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw her, He called her over and said to her, “Woman, you are freed from your sickness.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He laid His hands on her; and immediately she was made erect again and began glorifying God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the synagogue official, indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, began saying to the crowd in response, “There are six days in which work should be done; so come during them and get healed, and not on the Sabbath day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord answered him and said, “You hypocrites, does not each of you on the Sabbath untie his ox or his donkey from the stall and lead him away to water him?
speaker: Narrator

text: And this woman, a daughter of Abraham as she is, whom Satan has bound for eighteen long years, should she not have been released from this bond on the Sabbath day?”
speaker: Narrator

text: As He said this, all His opponents were being humiliated; and the entire crowd was rejoicing over all the glorious things being done by Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He was saying, “What is the kingdom of God like, and to what shall I compare it?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like a mustard seed, which a man took and threw into his own garden; and it grew and became a tree, and the birds of the air nested in its branches.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And again He said, “To what shall I compare the kingdom of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three pecks of flour until it was all leavened.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was passing through from one city and village to another, teaching, and proceeding on His way to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And someone said to Him, “Lord, are there just a few who are being saved?” And He said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Strive to enter through the narrow door; for many, I tell you, will seek to enter and will not be able.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once the head of the house gets up and shuts the door, and you begin to stand outside and knock on the door, saying, ‘Lord, open up to us!’ then He will answer and say to you, ‘I do not know where you are from.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in Your presence, and You taught in our streets’;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He will say, ‘I tell you, I do not know where you are from; depart from Me, all you evildoers.’
speaker: Narrator

text: In that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but yourselves being thrown out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will come from east and west and from north and south, and will recline at the table in the kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, some are last who will be first and some are first who will be last.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Just at that time some Pharisees approached, saying to Him, “Go away, leave here, for Herod wants to kill You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I reach My goal.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless I must journey on today and tomorrow and the next day; for it cannot be that a prophet would perish outside of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the city that kills the prophets and stones those sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, just as a hen gathers her brood under her wings, and you would not have it!
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, your house is left to you desolate; and I say to you, you will not see Me until the time comes when you say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
speaker: Narrator

text: It happened that when He went into the house of one of the leaders of the Pharisees on the Sabbath to eat bread, they were watching Him closely.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there in front of Him was a man suffering from dropsy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered and spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath, or not?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they kept silent. And He took hold of him and healed him, and sent him away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Which one of you will have a son or an ox fall into a well, and will not immediately pull him out on a Sabbath day?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they could make no reply to this.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He began speaking a parable to the invited guests when He noticed how they had been picking out the places of honor at the table, saying to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you are invited by someone to a wedding feast, do not take the place of honor, for someone more distinguished than you may have been invited by him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he who invited you both will come and say to you, ‘Give your place to this man,’ and then in disgrace you proceed to occupy the last place.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when you are invited, go and recline at the last place, so that when the one who has invited you comes, he may say to you, ‘Friend, move up higher’; then you will have honor in the sight of all who are at the table with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He also went on to say to the one who had invited Him, “When you give a luncheon or a dinner, do not invite your friends or your brothers or your relatives or rich neighbors, otherwise they may also invite you in return and that will be your repayment.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when you give a reception, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will be blessed, since they do not have the means to repay you; for you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When one of those who were reclining at the table with Him heard this, he said to Him, “Blessed is everyone who will eat bread in the kingdom of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said to him, “A man was giving a big dinner, and he invited many;
speaker: Narrator

text: and at the dinner hour he sent his slave to say to those who had been invited, ‘Come; for everything is ready now.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But they all alike began to make excuses. The first one said to him, ‘I have bought a piece of land and I need to go out and look at it; please consider me excused.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Another one said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going to try them out; please consider me excused.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Another one said, ‘I have married a wife, and for that reason I cannot come.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the slave came back and reported this to his master. Then the head of the household became angry and said to his slave, ‘Go out at once into the streets and lanes of the city and bring in here the poor and crippled and blind and lame.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the slave said, ‘Master, what you commanded has been done, and still there is room.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the master said to the slave, ‘Go out into the highways and along the hedges, and compel them to come in, so that my house may be filled.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I tell you, none of those men who were invited shall taste of my dinner.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now large crowds were going along with Him; and He turned and said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “If anyone comes to Me, and does not hate his own father and mother and wife and children and brothers and sisters, yes, and even his own life, he cannot be My disciple.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever does not carry his own cross and come after Me cannot be My disciple.
speaker: Narrator

text: For which one of you, when he wants to build a tower, does not first sit down and calculate the cost to see if he has enough to complete it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Otherwise, when he has laid a foundation and is not able to finish, all who observe it begin to ridicule him,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, ‘This man began to build and was not able to finish.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Or what king, when he sets out to meet another king in battle, will not first sit down and consider whether he is strong enough with ten thousand men to encounter the one coming against him with twenty thousand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or else, while the other is still far away, he sends a delegation and asks for terms of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, none of you can be My disciple who does not give up all his own possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore, salt is good; but if even salt has become tasteless, with what will it be seasoned?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is useless either for the soil or for the manure pile; it is thrown out. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now all the tax collectors and the sinners were coming near Him to listen to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both the Pharisees and the scribes began to grumble, saying, “This man receives sinners and eats with them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So He told them this parable, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “What man among you, if he has a hundred sheep and has lost one of them, does not leave the ninety-nine in the open pasture and go after the one which is lost until he finds it?
speaker: Narrator

text: When he has found it, he lays it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he comes home, he calls together his friends and his neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!’
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you that in the same way, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who need no repentance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Or what woman, if she has ten silver coins and loses one coin, does not light a lamp and sweep the house and search carefully until she finds it?
speaker: Narrator

text: When she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the coin which I had lost!’
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “A man had two sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of the estate that falls to me.’ So he divided his wealth between them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And not many days later, the younger son gathered everything together and went on a journey into a distant country, and there he squandered his estate with loose living.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when he had spent everything, a severe famine occurred in that country, and he began to be impoverished.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he went and hired himself out to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he would have gladly filled his stomach with the pods that the swine were eating, and no one was giving anything to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he came to his senses, he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired men have more than enough bread, but I am dying here with hunger!
speaker: Narrator

text: I will get up and go to my father, and will say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight;
speaker: Narrator

text: I am no longer worthy to be called your son; make me as one of your hired men.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: So he got up and came to his father. But while he was still a long way off, his father saw him and felt compassion for him, and ran and embraced him and kissed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight; I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the father said to his slaves, ‘Quickly bring out the best robe and put it on him, and put a ring on his hand and sandals on his feet;
speaker: Narrator

text: and bring the fattened calf, kill it, and let us eat and celebrate;
speaker: Narrator

text: for this son of mine was dead and has come to life again; he was lost and has been found.’ And they began to celebrate.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now his older son was in the field, and when he came and approached the house, he heard music and dancing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he summoned one of the servants and began inquiring what these things could be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf because he has received him back safe and sound.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But he became angry and was not willing to go in; and his father came out and began pleading with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered and said to his father, ‘Look! For so many years I have been serving you and I have never neglected a command of yours; and yet you have never given me a young goat, so that I might celebrate with my friends;
speaker: Narrator

text: but when this son of yours came, who has devoured your wealth with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to him, ‘Son, you have always been with me, and all that is mine is yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we had to celebrate and rejoice, for this brother of yours was dead and has begun to live, and was lost and has been found.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now He was also saying to the disciples, “There was a rich man who had a manager, and this manager was reported to him as squandering his possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called him and said to him, ‘What is this I hear about you? Give an accounting of your management, for you can no longer be manager.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The manager said to himself, ‘What shall I do, since my master is taking the management away from me? I am not strong enough to dig; I am ashamed to beg.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know what I shall do, so that when I am removed from the management people will welcome me into their homes.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he summoned each one of his master’s debtors, and he began saying to the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, ‘A hundred measures of oil.’ And he said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to another, ‘And how much do you owe?’ And he said, ‘A hundred measures of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And his master praised the unrighteous manager because he had acted shrewdly; for the sons of this age are more shrewd in relation to their own kind than the sons of light.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I say to you, make friends for yourselves by means of the wealth of unrighteousness, so that when it fails, they will receive you into the eternal dwellings.
speaker: Narrator

text: “He who is faithful in a very little thing is faithful also in much; and he who is unrighteous in a very little thing is unrighteous also in much.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore if you have not been faithful in the use of unrighteous wealth, who will entrust the true riches to you?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if you have not been faithful in the use of that which is another’s, who will give you that which is your own?
speaker: Narrator

text: No servant can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and wealth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, were listening to all these things and were scoffing at Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves in the sight of men, but God knows your hearts; for that which is highly esteemed among men is detestable in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Law and the Prophets were proclaimed until John; since that time the gospel of the kingdom of God has been preached, and everyone is forcing his way into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one stroke of a letter of the Law to fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Everyone who divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery, and he who marries one who is divorced from a husband commits adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now there was a rich man, and he habitually dressed in purple and fine linen, joyously living in splendor every day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a poor man named Lazarus was laid at his gate, covered with sores,
speaker: Narrator

text: and longing to be fed with the crumbs which were falling from the rich man’s table; besides, even the dogs were coming and licking his sores.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the poor man died and was carried away by the angels to Abraham’s bosom; and the rich man also died and was buried.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Hades he lifted up his eyes, being in torment, and saw Abraham far away and Lazarus in his bosom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cried out and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus so that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool off my tongue, for I am in agony in this flame.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But Abraham said, ‘Child, remember that during your life you received your good things, and likewise Lazarus bad things; but now he is being comforted here, and you are in agony.
speaker: Narrator

text: And besides all this, between us and you there is a great chasm fixed, so that those who wish to come over from here to you will not be able, and that none may cross over from there to us.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, ‘Then I beg you, father, that you send him to my father’s house—
speaker: Narrator

text: for I have five brothers—in order that he may warn them, so that they will not also come to this place of torment.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But Abraham said, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets; let them hear them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if someone goes to them from the dead, they will repent!’
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to him, ‘If they do not listen to Moses and the Prophets, they will not be persuaded even if someone rises from the dead.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to His disciples, “It is inevitable that stumbling blocks come, but woe to him through whom they come!
speaker: Narrator

text: It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck and he were thrown into the sea, than that he would cause one of these little ones to stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be on your guard! If your brother sins, rebuke him; and if he repents, forgive him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he sins against you seven times a day, and returns to you seven times, saying, ‘I repent,’ forgive him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, “If you had faith like a mustard seed, you would say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and be planted in the sea’; and it would obey you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Which of you, having a slave plowing or tending sheep, will say to him when he has come in from the field, ‘Come immediately and sit down to eat’?
speaker: Narrator

text: But will he not say to him, ‘Prepare something for me to eat, and properly clothe yourself and serve me while I eat and drink; and afterward you may eat and drink’?
speaker: Narrator

text: He does not thank the slave because he did the things which were commanded, does he?
speaker: Narrator

text: So you too, when you do all the things which are commanded you, say, ‘We are unworthy slaves; we have done only that which we ought to have done.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: While He was on the way to Jerusalem, He was passing between Samaria and Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: As He entered a village, ten leprous men who stood at a distance met Him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they raised their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When He saw them, He said to them, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” And as they were going, they were cleansed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now one of them, when he saw that he had been healed, turned back, glorifying God with a loud voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he fell on his face at His feet, giving thanks to Him. And he was a Samaritan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus answered and said, “Were there not ten cleansed? But the nine—where are they?
speaker: Narrator

text: Was no one found who returned to give glory to God, except this foreigner?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to him, “Stand up and go; your faith has made you well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now having been questioned by the Pharisees as to when the kingdom of God was coming, He answered them and said, “The kingdom of God is not coming with signs to be observed;
speaker: Narrator

text: nor will they say, ‘Look, here it is!’ or, ‘There it is!’ For behold, the kingdom of God is in your midst.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to the disciples, “The days will come when you will long to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will say to you, ‘Look there! Look here!’ Do not go away, and do not run after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just like the lightning, when it flashes out of one part of the sky, shines to the other part of the sky, so will the Son of Man be in His day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But first He must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And just as it happened in the days of Noah, so it will be also in the days of the Son of Man:
speaker: Narrator

text: they were eating, they were drinking, they were marrying, they were being given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered the ark, and the flood came and destroyed them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was the same as happened in the days of Lot: they were eating, they were drinking, they were buying, they were selling, they were planting, they were building;
speaker: Narrator

text: but on the day that Lot went out from Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven and destroyed them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will be just the same on the day that the Son of Man is revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day, the one who is on the housetop and whose goods are in the house must not go down to take them out; and likewise the one who is in the field must not turn back.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Lot’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever seeks to keep his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life will preserve it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, on that night there will be two in one bed; one will be taken and the other will be left.
speaker: Narrator

text: There will be two women grinding at the same place; one will be taken and the other will be left.
speaker: Narrator

text: [Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other will be left.”]
speaker: Narrator

text: And answering they said to Him, “Where, Lord?” And He said to them, “Where the body is, there also the vultures will be gathered.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now He was telling them a parable to show that at all times they ought to pray and not to lose heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “In a certain city there was a judge who did not fear God and did not respect man.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a widow in that city, and she kept coming to him, saying, ‘Give me legal protection from my opponent.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For a while he was unwilling; but afterward he said to himself, ‘Even though I do not fear God nor respect man,
speaker: Narrator

text: yet because this widow bothers me, I will give her legal protection, otherwise by continually coming she will wear me out.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, “Hear what the unrighteous judge said;
speaker: Narrator

text: now, will not God bring about justice for His elect who cry to Him day and night, and will He delay long over them?
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you that He will bring about justice for them quickly. However, when the Son of Man comes, will He find faith on the earth?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He also told this parable to some people who trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and viewed others with contempt:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Two men went up into the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisee stood and was praying this to himself: ‘God, I thank You that I am not like other people: swindlers, unjust, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.
speaker: Narrator

text: I fast twice a week; I pay tithes of all that I get.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the tax collector, standing some distance away, was even unwilling to lift up his eyes to heaven, but was beating his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, the sinner!’
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, this man went to his house justified rather than the other; for everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were bringing even their babies to Him so that He would touch them, but when the disciples saw it, they began rebuking them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus called for them, saying, “Permit the children to come to Me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child will not enter it at all.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A ruler questioned Him, saying, “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good except God alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know the commandments, ‘Do not commit adultery, Do not murder, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honor your father and mother.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “All these things I have kept from my youth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this, He said to him, “One thing you still lack; sell all that you possess and distribute it to the poor, and you shall have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he had heard these things, he became very sad, for he was extremely rich.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus looked at him and said, “How hard it is for those who are wealthy to enter the kingdom of God!
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They who heard it said, “Then who can be saved?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He said, “The things that are impossible with people are possible with God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said, “Behold, we have left our own homes and followed You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Truly I say to you, there is no one who has left house or wife or brothers or parents or children, for the sake of the kingdom of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who will not receive many times as much at this time and in the age to come, eternal life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He took the twelve aside and said to them, “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all things which are written through the prophets about the Son of Man will be accomplished.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He will be handed over to the Gentiles, and will be mocked and mistreated and spit upon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and after they have scourged Him, they will kill Him; and the third day He will rise again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the disciples understood none of these things, and the meaning of this statement was hidden from them, and they did not comprehend the things that were said.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus was approaching Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the road begging.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now hearing a crowd going by, he began to inquire what this was.
speaker: Narrator

text: They told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called out, saying, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who led the way were sternly telling him to be quiet; but he kept crying out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus stopped and commanded that he be brought to Him; and when he came near, He questioned him,
speaker: Narrator

text: “What do you want Me to do for you?” And he said, “Lord, I want to regain my sight!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight; your faith has made you well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately he regained his sight and began following Him, glorifying God; and when all the people saw it, they gave praise to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He entered Jericho and was passing through.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a man called by the name of Zaccheus; he was a chief tax collector and he was rich.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zaccheus was trying to see who Jesus was, and was unable because of the crowd, for he was small in stature.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he ran on ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree in order to see Him, for He was about to pass through that way.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus came to the place, He looked up and said to him, “Zaccheus, hurry and come down, for today I must stay at your house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hurried and came down and received Him gladly.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw it, they all began to grumble, saying, “He has gone to be the guest of a man who is a sinner.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Zaccheus stopped and said to the Lord, “Behold, Lord, half of my possessions I will give to the poor, and if I have defrauded anyone of anything, I will give back four times as much.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this house, because he, too, is a son of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man has come to seek and to save that which was lost.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were listening to these things, Jesus went on to tell a parable, because He was near Jerusalem, and they supposed that the kingdom of God was going to appear immediately.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He said, “A nobleman went to a distant country to receive a kingdom for himself, and then return.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called ten of his slaves, and gave them ten minas and said to them, ‘Do business with this until I come back.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But his citizens hated him and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We do not want this man to reign over us.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When he returned, after receiving the kingdom, he ordered that these slaves, to whom he had given the money, be called to him so that he might know what business they had done.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first appeared, saying, ‘Master, your mina has made ten minas more.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to him, ‘Well done, good slave, because you have been faithful in a very little thing, you are to be in authority over ten cities.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The second came, saying, ‘Your mina, master, has made five minas.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to him also, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Another came, saying, ‘Master, here is your mina, which I kept put away in a handkerchief;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I was afraid of you, because you are an exacting man; you take up what you did not lay down and reap what you did not sow.’
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to him, ‘By your own words I will judge you, you worthless slave. Did you know that I am an exacting man, taking up what I did not lay down and reaping what I did not sow?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then why did you not put my money in the bank, and having come, I would have collected it with interest?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to the bystanders, ‘Take the mina away from him and give it to the one who has the ten minas.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to him, ‘Master, he has ten minas already.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you that to everyone who has, more shall be given, but from the one who does not have, even what he does have shall be taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these enemies of mine, who did not want me to reign over them, bring them here and slay them in my presence.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After He had said these things, He was going on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He approached Bethphage and Bethany, near the mount that is called Olivet, He sent two of the disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Go into the village ahead of you; there, as you enter, you will find a colt tied on which no one yet has ever sat; untie it and bring it here.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ you shall say, ‘The Lord has need of it.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So those who were sent went away and found it just as He had told them.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “The Lord has need of it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought it to Jesus, and they threw their coats on the colt and put Jesus on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: As He was going, they were spreading their coats on the road.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as He was approaching, near the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of the disciples began to praise God joyfully with a loud voice for all the miracles which they had seen,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, rebuke Your disciples.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus answered, “I tell you, if these become silent, the stones will cry out!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When He approached Jerusalem, He saw the city and wept over it,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “If you had known in this day, even you, the things which make for peace! But now they have been hidden from your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the days will come upon you when your enemies will throw up a barricade against you, and surround you and hem you in on every side,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they will level you to the ground and your children within you, and they will not leave in you one stone upon another, because you did not recognize the time of your visitation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus entered the temple and began to drive out those who were selling,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying to them, “It is written, ‘And My house shall be a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a robbers’ den.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was teaching daily in the temple; but the chief priests and the scribes and the leading men among the people were trying to destroy Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they could not find anything that they might do, for all the people were hanging on to every word He said.
speaker: Narrator

text: On one of the days while He was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes with the elders confronted Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they spoke, saying to Him, “Tell us by what authority You are doing these things, or who is the one who gave You this authority?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered and said to them, “I will also ask you a question, and you tell Me:
speaker: Narrator

text: Was the baptism of John from heaven or from men?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why did you not believe him?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us to death, for they are convinced that John was a prophet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they answered that they did not know where it came from.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “Nor will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard and rented it out to vine-growers, and went on a journey for a long time.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the harvest time he sent a slave to the vine-growers, so that they would give him some of the produce of the vineyard; but the vine-growers beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he proceeded to send another slave; and they beat him also and treated him shamefully and sent him away empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he proceeded to send a third; and this one also they wounded and cast out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The owner of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son; perhaps they will respect him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the vine-growers saw him, they reasoned with one another, saying, ‘This is the heir; let us kill him so that the inheritance will be ours.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What, then, will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
speaker: Narrator

text: He will come and destroy these vine-growers and will give the vineyard to others.” When they heard it, they said, “May it never be!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Jesus looked at them and said, “What then is this that is written:
‘The stone which the builders rejected,
This became the chief corner stone’?
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces; but on whomever it falls, it will scatter him like dust.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The scribes and the chief priests tried to lay hands on Him that very hour, and they feared the people; for they understood that He spoke this parable against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they watched Him, and sent spies who pretended to be righteous, in order that they might catch Him in some statement, so that they could deliver Him to the rule and the authority of the governor.
speaker: Narrator

text: They questioned Him, saying, “Teacher, we know that You speak and teach correctly, and You are not partial to any, but teach the way of God in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He detected their trickery and said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Show Me a denarius. Whose likeness and inscription does it have?” They said, “Caesar’s.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Then render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were unable to catch Him in a saying in the presence of the people; and being amazed at His answer, they became silent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there came to Him some of the Sadducees (who say that there is no resurrection),
speaker: Narrator

text: and they questioned Him, saying, “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies, having a wife, and he is childless, his brother should marry the wife and raise up children to his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were seven brothers; and the first took a wife and died childless;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the second
speaker: Narrator

text: and the third married her; and in the same way all seven died, leaving no children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally the woman died also.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the resurrection therefore, which one’s wife will she be? For all seven had married her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “The sons of this age marry and are given in marriage,
speaker: Narrator

text: but those who are considered worthy to attain to that age and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry nor are given in marriage;
speaker: Narrator

text: for they cannot even die anymore, because they are like angels, and are sons of God, being sons of the resurrection.
speaker: Narrator

text: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed, in the passage about the burning bush, where he calls the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now He is not the God of the dead but of the living; for all live to Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the scribes answered and said, “Teacher, You have spoken well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For they did not have courage to question Him any longer about anything.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He said to them, “How is it that they say the Christ is David’s son?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For David himself says in the book of Psalms,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at My right hand,
speaker: Narrator

text: Until I make Your enemies a footstool for Your feet.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore David calls Him ‘Lord,’ and how is He his son?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And while all the people were listening, He said to the disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk around in long robes, and love respectful greetings in the market places, and chief seats in the synagogues and places of honor at banquets,
speaker: Narrator

text: who devour widows’ houses, and for appearance’s sake offer long prayers. These will receive greater condemnation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He looked up and saw the rich putting their gifts into the treasury.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He saw a poor widow putting in two small copper coins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “Truly I say to you, this poor widow put in more than all of them;
speaker: Narrator

text: for they all out of their surplus put into the offering; but she out of her poverty put in all that she had to live on.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And while some were talking about the temple, that it was adorned with beautiful stones and votive gifts, He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “As for these things which you are looking at, the days will come in which there will not be left one stone upon another which will not be torn down.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They questioned Him, saying, “Teacher, when therefore will these things happen? And what will be the sign when these things are about to take place?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “See to it that you are not misled; for many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am He,’ and, ‘The time is near.’ Do not go after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you hear of wars and disturbances, do not be terrified; for these things must take place first, but the end does not follow immediately.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He continued by saying to them, “Nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom,
speaker: Narrator

text: and there will be great earthquakes, and in various places plagues and famines; and there will be terrors and great signs from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and will persecute you, delivering you to the synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for My name’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will lead to an opportunity for your testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: So make up your minds not to prepare beforehand to defend yourselves;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I will give you utterance and wisdom which none of your opponents will be able to resist or refute.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you will be betrayed even by parents and brothers and relatives and friends, and they will put some of you to death,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will be hated by all because of My name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet not a hair of your head will perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: By your endurance you will gain your lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then recognize that her desolation is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then those who are in Judea must flee to the mountains, and those who are in the midst of the city must leave, and those who are in the country must not enter the city;
speaker: Narrator

text: because these are days of vengeance, so that all things which are written will be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babies in those days; for there will be great distress upon the land and wrath to this people;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all the nations; and Jerusalem will be trampled under foot by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: “There will be signs in sun and moon and stars, and on the earth dismay among nations, in perplexity at the roaring of the sea and the waves,
speaker: Narrator

text: men fainting from fear and the expectation of the things which are coming upon the world; for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when these things begin to take place, straighten up and lift up your heads, because your redemption is drawing near.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He told them a parable: “Behold the fig tree and all the trees;
speaker: Narrator

text: as soon as they put forth leaves, you see it and know for yourselves that summer is now near.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you also, when you see these things happening, recognize that the kingdom of God is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all things take place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Be on guard, so that your hearts will not be weighted down with dissipation and drunkenness and the worries of life, and that day will not come on you suddenly like a trap;
speaker: Narrator

text: for it will come upon all those who dwell on the face of all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But keep on the alert at all times, praying that you may have strength to escape all these things that are about to take place, and to stand before the Son of Man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now during the day He was teaching in the temple, but at evening He would go out and spend the night on the mount that is called Olivet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people would get up early in the morning to come to Him in the temple to listen to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief priests and the scribes were seeking how they might put Him to death; for they were afraid of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Satan entered into Judas who was called Iscariot, belonging to the number of the twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went away and discussed with the chief priests and officers how he might betray Him to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were glad and agreed to give him money.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he consented, and began seeking a good opportunity to betray Him to them apart from the crowd.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came the first day of Unleavened Bread on which the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, so that we may eat it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “When you have entered the city, a man will meet you carrying a pitcher of water; follow him into the house that he enters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room in which I may eat the Passover with My disciples?”’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will show you a large, furnished upper room; prepare it there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they left and found everything just as He had told them; and they prepared the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the hour had come, He reclined at the table, and the apostles with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I say to you, I shall never again eat it until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He had taken a cup and given thanks, He said, “Take this and share it among yourselves;
speaker: Narrator

text: for I say to you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine from now on until the kingdom of God comes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He had taken some bread and given thanks, He broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This is My body which is given for you; do this in remembrance of Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the same way He took the cup after they had eaten, saying, “This cup which is poured out for you is the new covenant in My blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: But behold, the hand of the one betraying Me is with Mine on the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: For indeed, the Son of Man is going as it has been determined; but woe to that man by whom He is betrayed!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they began to discuss among themselves which one of them it might be who was going to do this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there arose also a dispute among them as to which one of them was regarded to be greatest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them; and those who have authority over them are called ‘Benefactors.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But it is not this way with you, but the one who is the greatest among you must become like the youngest, and the leader like the servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who is greater, the one who reclines at the table or the one who serves? Is it not the one who reclines at the table? But I am among you as the one who serves.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You are those who have stood by Me in My trials;
speaker: Narrator

text: and just as My Father has granted Me a kingdom, I grant you
speaker: Narrator

text: that you may eat and drink at My table in My kingdom, and you will sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan has demanded permission to sift you like wheat;
speaker: Narrator

text: but I have prayed for you, that your faith may not fail; and you, when once you have turned again, strengthen your brothers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to Him, “Lord, with You I am ready to go both to prison and to death!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “I say to you, Peter, the rooster will not crow today until you have denied three times that you know Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “When I sent you out without money belt and bag and sandals, you did not lack anything, did you?” They said, “No, nothing.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “But now, whoever has a money belt is to take it along, likewise also a bag, and whoever has no sword is to sell his coat and buy one.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I tell you that this which is written must be fulfilled in Me, ‘And He was numbered with transgressors’; for that which refers to Me has its fulfillment.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Lord, look, here are two swords.” And He said to them, “It is enough.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came out and proceeded as was His custom to the Mount of Olives; and the disciples also followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He arrived at the place, He said to them, “Pray that you may not enter into temptation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He withdrew from them about a stone’s throw, and He knelt down and began to pray,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Father, if You are willing, remove this cup from Me; yet not My will, but Yours be done.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now an angel from heaven appeared to Him, strengthening Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And being in agony He was praying very fervently; and His sweat became like drops of blood, falling down upon the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He rose from prayer, He came to the disciples and found them sleeping from sorrow,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray that you may not enter into temptation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While He was still speaking, behold, a crowd came, and the one called Judas, one of the twelve, was preceding them; and he approached Jesus to kiss Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When those who were around Him saw what was going to happen, they said, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of them struck the slave of the high priest and cut off his right ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus answered and said, “Stop! No more of this.” And He touched his ear and healed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to the chief priests and officers of the temple and elders who had come against Him, “Have you come out with swords and clubs as you would against a robber?
speaker: Narrator

text: While I was with you daily in the temple, you did not lay hands on Me; but this hour and the power of darkness are yours.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Having arrested Him, they led Him away and brought Him to the house of the high priest; but Peter was following at a distance.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and had sat down together, Peter was sitting among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a servant-girl, seeing him as he sat in the firelight and looking intently at him, said, “This man was with Him too.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he denied it, saying, “Woman, I do not know Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A little later, another saw him and said, “You are one of them too!” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
speaker: Narrator

text: After about an hour had passed, another man began to insist, saying, “Certainly this man also was with Him, for he is a Galilean too.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are talking about.” Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord turned and looked at Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how He had told him, “Before a rooster crows today, you will deny Me three times.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went out and wept bitterly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the men who were holding Jesus in custody were mocking Him and beating Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they blindfolded Him and were asking Him, saying, “Prophesy, who is the one who hit You?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were saying many other things against Him, blaspheming.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was day, the Council of elders of the people assembled, both chief priests and scribes, and they led Him away to their council chamber, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “If You are the Christ, tell us.” But He said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe;
speaker: Narrator

text: and if I ask a question, you will not answer.
speaker: Narrator

text: But from now on the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they all said, “Are You the Son of God, then?” And He said to them, “Yes, I am.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said, “What further need do we have of testimony? For we have heard it ourselves from His own mouth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the whole body of them got up and brought Him before Pilate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they began to accuse Him, saying, “We found this man misleading our nation and forbidding to pay taxes to Caesar, and saying that He Himself is Christ, a King.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate asked Him, saying, “Are You the King of the Jews?” And He answered him and said, “It is as you say.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no guilt in this man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they kept on insisting, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching all over Judea, starting from Galilee even as far as this place.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Pilate heard it, he asked whether the man was a Galilean.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he learned that He belonged to Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent Him to Herod, who himself also was in Jerusalem at that time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Herod was very glad when he saw Jesus; for he had wanted to see Him for a long time, because he had been hearing about Him and was hoping to see some sign performed by Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he questioned Him at some length; but He answered him nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the chief priests and the scribes were standing there, accusing Him vehemently.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Herod with his soldiers, after treating Him with contempt and mocking Him, dressed Him in a gorgeous robe and sent Him back to Pilate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Herod and Pilate became friends with one another that very day; for before they had been enemies with each other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate summoned the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to them, “You brought this man to me as one who incites the people to rebellion, and behold, having examined Him before you, I have found no guilt in this man regarding the charges which you make against Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: No, nor has Herod, for he sent Him back to us; and behold, nothing deserving death has been done by Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I will punish Him and release Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: [Now he was obliged to release to them at the feast one prisoner.]
speaker: Narrator

text: But they cried out all together, saying, “Away with this man, and release for us Barabbas!”
speaker: Narrator

text: (He was one who had been thrown into prison for an insurrection made in the city, and for murder.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate, wanting to release Jesus, addressed them again,
speaker: Narrator

text: but they kept on calling out, saying, “Crucify, crucify Him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them the third time, “Why, what evil has this man done? I have found in Him no guilt demanding death; therefore I will punish Him and release Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were insistent, with loud voices asking that He be crucified. And their voices began to prevail.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate pronounced sentence that their demand be granted.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he released the man they were asking for who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, but he delivered Jesus to their will.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they led Him away, they seized a man, Simon of Cyrene, coming in from the country, and placed on him the cross to carry behind Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And following Him was a large crowd of the people, and of women who were mourning and lamenting Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus turning to them said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, stop weeping for Me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
speaker: Narrator

text: For behold, the days are coming when they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bore, and the breasts that never nursed.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us,’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For if they do these things when the tree is green, what will happen when it is dry?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Two others also, who were criminals, were being led away to be put to death with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the place called The Skull, there they crucified Him and the criminals, one on the right and the other on the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus was saying, “Father, forgive them; for they do not know what they are doing.” And they cast lots, dividing up His garments among themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people stood by, looking on. And even the rulers were sneering at Him, saying, “He saved others; let Him save Himself if this is the Christ of God, His Chosen One.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The soldiers also mocked Him, coming up to Him, offering Him sour wine,
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, “If You are the King of the Jews, save Yourself!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was also an inscription above Him, “THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the criminals who were hanged there was hurling abuse at Him, saying, “Are You not the Christ? Save Yourself and us!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the other answered, and rebuking him said, “Do you not even fear God, since you are under the same sentence of condemnation?
speaker: Narrator

text: And we indeed are suffering justly, for we are receiving what we deserve for our deeds; but this man has done nothing wrong.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was saying, “Jesus, remember me when You come in Your kingdom!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to him, “Truly I say to you, today you shall be with Me in Paradise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness fell over the whole land until the ninth hour,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the sun was obscured; and the veil of the temple was torn in two.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus, crying out with a loud voice, said, “Father, into Your hands I commit My spirit.” Having said this, He breathed His last.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the centurion saw what had happened, he began praising God, saying, “Certainly this man was innocent.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the crowds who came together for this spectacle, when they observed what had happened, began to return, beating their breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all His acquaintances and the women who accompanied Him from Galilee were standing at a distance, seeing these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a man named Joseph, who was a member of the Council, a good and righteous man
speaker: Narrator

text: (he had not consented to their plan and action), a man from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, who was waiting for the kingdom of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: this man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took it down and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid Him in a tomb cut into the rock, where no one had ever lain.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was the preparation day, and the Sabbath was about to begin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the women who had come with Him out of Galilee followed, and saw the tomb and how His body was laid.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they returned and prepared spices and perfumes.
And on the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
speaker: Narrator

text: But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they came to the tomb bringing the spices which they had prepared.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they found the stone rolled away from the tomb,
speaker: Narrator

text: but when they entered, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were perplexed about this, behold, two men suddenly stood near them in dazzling clothing;
speaker: Narrator

text: and as the women were terrified and bowed their faces to the ground, the men said to them, “Why do you seek the living One among the dead?
speaker: Narrator

text: He is not here, but He has risen. Remember how He spoke to you while He was still in Galilee,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying that the Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they remembered His words,
speaker: Narrator

text: and returned from the tomb and reported all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they were Mary Magdalene and Joanna and Mary the mother of James; also the other women with them were telling these things to the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these words appeared to them as nonsense, and they would not believe them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb; stooping and looking in, he saw the linen wrappings only; and he went away to his home, marveling at what had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was about seven miles from Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were talking with each other about all these things which had taken place.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were talking and discussing, Jesus Himself approached and began traveling with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But their eyes were prevented from recognizing Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “What are these words that you are exchanging with one another as you are walking?” And they stood still, looking sad.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of them, named Cleopas, answered and said to Him, “Are You the only one visiting Jerusalem and unaware of the things which have happened here in these days?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “What things?” And they said to Him, “The things about Jesus the Nazarene, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word in the sight of God and all the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered Him to the sentence of death, and crucified Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we were hoping that it was He who was going to redeem Israel. Indeed, besides all this, it is the third day since these things happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: But also some women among us amazed us. When they were at the tomb early in the morning,
speaker: Narrator

text: and did not find His body, they came, saying that they had also seen a vision of angels who said that He was alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just exactly as the women also had said; but Him they did not see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “O foolish men and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!
speaker: Narrator

text: Was it not necessary for the Christ to suffer these things and to enter into His glory?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then beginning with Moses and with all the prophets, He explained to them the things concerning Himself in all the Scriptures.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they approached the village where they were going, and He acted as though He were going farther.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they urged Him, saying, “Stay with us, for it is getting toward evening, and the day is now nearly over.” So He went in to stay with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He had reclined at the table with them, He took the bread and blessed it, and breaking it, He began giving it to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then their eyes were opened and they recognized Him; and He vanished from their sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to one another, “Were not our hearts burning within us while He was speaking to us on the road, while He was explaining the Scriptures to us?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they got up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem, and found gathered together the eleven and those who were with them,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “The Lord has really risen and has appeared to Simon.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They began to relate their experiences on the road and how He was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were telling these things, He Himself stood in their midst and said to them, “Peace be to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were startled and frightened and thought that they were seeing a spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Why are you troubled, and why do doubts arise in your hearts?
speaker: Narrator

text: See My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself; touch Me and see, for a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you see that I have.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He had said this, He showed them His hands and His feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they still could not believe it because of their joy and amazement, He said to them, “Have you anything here to eat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave Him a piece of a broiled fish;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He took it and ate it before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now He said to them, “These are My words which I spoke to you while I was still with you, that all things which are written about Me in the Law of Moses and the Prophets and the Psalms must be fulfilled.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He opened their minds to understand the Scriptures,
speaker: Narrator

text: and He said to them, “Thus it is written, that the Christ would suffer and rise again from the dead the third day,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that repentance for forgiveness of sins would be proclaimed in His name to all the nations, beginning from Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are witnesses of these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, I am sending forth the promise of My Father upon you; but you are to stay in the city until you are clothed with power from on high.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He led them out as far as Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: While He was blessing them, He parted from them and was carried up into heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they, after worshiping Him, returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
speaker: Narrator

text: and were continually in the temple praising God.
speaker: Narrator
